intro: Ozothamnus bracteolatus, commonly known as the silverleaf chamaedorea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, rounded leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Ozothamnus bracteolatus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
